intro: Stichorkis govidjoae, commonly known as the Govejoa tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a drupe, typically containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy pulp. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
